title: League has made me a stronger person
body:
It's odd to say, but I think League of Legends has made me a stronger person: a little more specifically, it has made me a stronger gamer, a wiser gamer, a more strategic gamer, a more level-headed individual, a more laid-back individual, and a funner person.

Why?

Because I've been doing something a lot of LOL players don't - I've been getting better. Not just better at the game, but becoming a better person. When my team feeds like cray-cray, I don't get so angry. Just let it pass because I'll forget all about it when I'm ten minutes out. I remember my best games and my best plays a lot more. I'm striving to enjoy the game more - I still take it seriously, but I remember that it is just a game and NOT my life.

I work in an environment where customers are always angry - League has helped me smile and laugh at angry people. Why? Because, 99% of the time, they're angry and raging at me, for something I didn't have any part of!! I've learned that I cannot change or control others, but better control myself.

Humble in victory and graceful in defeat... I think the phrase goes like that....?

When I first started playing, I used to get really upset when I lost or if someone fed, after a while I stopped caring altogether; and that didn't just affect my league life, it led into my personal and relationship side of my life. 

I stopped being emotional towards my girlfriend, stopped caring about anything that went on around me for the longest of time.  Then I had the hugest wake up call when my ex decided to talk to me again wishing for the old me. 

After that happened I found the split between League and my personal life and was able to not care in league, and care more than I ever had in my personal life. 

I too had changed for the best thanks to League

Thank you Rito.

Eh, I find that as my rage died down, so has my interest in the game. Emotional investment is proportional to enjoyment, even if it brings aggravation. If you always hated it, you'd stop playing. Instead I play for those highs, or at least I used to. I don't get mad anymore because I just don't care. The excitement and experimentation that MOBAs held in the days of original Dota 1, or beta LoL, have gone stale with intrenched metas and homogenized champions. A game that makes you emotional is, in my opinion, a good thing.
